House Bill/Resolution NO. HB05109
FULL TITLE : AN ACT PROHIBITING TELECOMMUNICATION COMPANIES FROM IMPOSING EXPIRATION DATES ON MOBILE PREPAID CALL AND TEXT CARDS AND THE FORFEITURE OF LOAD CREDITS, PROVIDING PENALTIES FOR VIOLATION THEREOF
SHORT TITLE : " Prepaid Load Protection Act "
ABSTRACT : Enumerates what constitute as prohibited acts of any telecommunications network providing prepaid services and are declared unlawful as stated in the title, which also includes refusal to give refund to any prepaid subscriber whose load credits were forfeited without any valid cause.
PRINCIPAL AUTHOR/S : CASTELO, WINSTON "WINNIE"
DATE FILED : 2017-02-22
SIGNIFICANCE: NATIONAL
CO-AUTHORS (Journal Entries) :
1. Sy-Alvarado (079 2017-03-07)2. Violago (002 2017-07-25)
ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE
COMMITEE HEARINGS/ACTIONS:
      1. Scheduled for meeting/hearing on 2017-09-27
      2. Under deliberation by the Mother Committee on 2018-02-14
      3. Deliberated upon by the Mother Committee on 2018-03-14
          -After a thorough deliberation, Chairman Victor Yap proposed for the creation of a Technical Working Group (TWG) to dig deeper on the issues of load expiration, vanishing loads, drop calls, running cost of calls and handling of complaints filed by subscribers/consumers.
      4. Under study by the Technical Working Group(TWG) on 2018-04-24
      5. Under study by the Technical Working Group(TWG) on 2018-05-15
